artists.name: Vybz Kartel
artists.bio: Adidja Azim Palmer, better known as Vybz Kartel, is a Jamaican reggae and dancehall deejay. Among his various nicknames, he is referred to as World Boss. He is considered one of the most influential dancehall artists of all time.

artists.name: Skillibeng
artists.bio: Emwah Warmington, known professionally as Skillibeng, is a Jamaican dancehall deejay from St. Thomas, Jamaica. He is known for his unique style that blends traditional dancehall with modern trap influences.

artists.name: Shenseea
artists.bio: Chinsea Linda Lee, known professionally as Shenseea, is a Jamaican dancehall and reggae recording artist. She is known for her versatility, singing and deejaying in both English and Patois.

artists.name: Popcaan
artists.bio: Andre Hugh Sutherland, known professionally as Popcaan, is a Jamaican deejay, singer, and songwriter from St. Thomas Parish, Jamaica. He is one of the most popular dancehall artists in Jamaica and internationally.

artists.name: Kano
artists.bio: Kane Brett Robinson, better known as Kano, is a British rapper, songwriter and actor from East Ham, London. He has incorporated dancehall and reggae influences into his UK rap style.

artists.name: Stylo G
artists.bio: Jason McDermott, known professionally as Stylo G, is a British-Jamaican dancehall deejay and rapper from Croydon, South London. He is known for his UK dancehall style.

artists.name: Kardinal Offishall
artists.bio: Jason Drew Harrow, better known by his stage name Kardinal Offishall, is a Canadian rapper, record producer, DJ, and record executive. Often credited as Canada's 'hip hop ambassador'.

artists.name: Maestro Fresh Wes
artists.bio: Wesley Williams, known professionally as Maestro Fresh Wes, is a Canadian rapper, record producer, actor, and author. One of the pioneers of Canadian hip hop with dancehall influences.

artists.name: Burna Boy
artists.bio: Damini Ebunoluwa Ogulu, known professionally as Burna Boy, is a Nigerian singer, songwriter, rapper, and dancer. He is one of the biggest and most successful African artists. He has won a Grammy Award and has been instrumental in the global rise of Afrobeats.

artists.name: Wizkid
artists.bio: Ayodeji Ibrahim Balogun, known professionally as Wizkid, is a Nigerian singer and songwriter. He began recording music at the age of 11 and managed to release a collaborative album with the Glorious Five. Wizkid is considered one of the pioneers of Afrobeats.

artists.name: Davido
artists.bio: David Adedeji Adeleke, known professionally as Davido, is a Nigerian-American singer, songwriter, and record producer. He is one of the most influential artists in the Nigerian music industry and has received numerous awards.

artists.name: Omah Lay
artists.bio: Stanley Omah Didia, known professionally as Omah Lay, is a Nigerian singer, songwriter and record producer. He gained prominence with his self-produced single 'Bad Influence' and his debut EP 'Get Layd'.

artists.name: Stonebwoy
artists.bio: Livingstone Etse Satekla, better known by his stage name Stonebwoy, is a Ghanaian Afropop, dancehall and reggae musician. He is the CEO of Burniton Music Group and has won numerous awards.

artists.name: Shatta Wale
artists.bio: Charles Nii Armah Mensah Jr., known professionally as Shatta Wale, is a Ghanaian dancehall recording artist. He is known for his collaborations with international artists and his energetic performances.

artists.name: Black Sherif
artists.bio: Mohammed Ismail Sherif, known professionally as Black Sherif, is a Ghanaian musician who specializes in hip hop and Afrobeats. He gained popularity with his 'First Sermon' and 'Second Sermon' tracks.

artists.name: Master KG
artists.bio: Kgaogelo Moagi, known professionally as Master KG, is a South African musician and record producer. He gained international recognition with his hit single 'Jerusalema'.

artists.name: Machel Montano
artists.bio: Machel Jesus Montano is a Trinidadian soca recording artist and record producer. Known as the 'King of Soca', he is one of the most successful soca artists in history.
artists.birthPlace: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago

artists.name: Bunji Garlin
artists.bio: Ian Antonio Alvarez, better known by his stage name Bunji Garlin, is a Trinidadian ragga soca artist. He is also affectionately known as the 'Viking of Soca'.

artists.name: Rihanna
artists.bio: Robyn Rihanna Fenty is a Barbadian singer, actress, and businesswoman. Born in Saint Michael and raised in Bridgetown, Barbados, Rihanna has incorporated Caribbean influences into her music.

artists.name: Admiral T
artists.bio: Christy Campbell, better known as Admiral T, is a French dancehall and reggae artist from Guadeloupe. He is one of the most prominent Caribbean artists in the French music scene.

artists.name: Tego Calderón
artists.bio: Tegui Calderón Rosario, known professionally as Tego Calderón, is a Puerto Rican rapper, singer and actor. He has incorporated reggaeton with elements of dancehall and reggae.

artists.name: El General
artists.bio: Edgardo Armando Franco, better known as El General, is a Panamanian rapper and reggaeton artist considered by some to be one of the fathers of reggaeton music.

artists.name: Major Lazer
artists.bio: Major Lazer is an American electronic music project created by Diplo. The group has incorporated dancehall, reggae, and Caribbean influences into electronic dance music.
